Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "The Time Machine" as a potential recommendation.
"The Time Machine" is a classic science fiction film from the 1900s, directed by H.G. Wells and starring George Peabody Jones (played by Edward Arnold)) as the protagonist of the story.
The plot of "The Time Machine" follows this structure: A man named George Peabody Jones invents a machine that can take him back in time to before his birth.
He decides to go back 80 million years, when the Earth was still forming and life had not yet evolved.
After going back through various stages of the Earth's history, he finally arrives at 1456AD, just a few hundred years after the invention of printing by Johannes Gutenberg in the year 1440AD.
As he looks around at the people and things that are present in this time period, he becomes increasingly overwhelmed by the vastness of time, the complexity of human history and society, and the sheer magnitude of the knowledge and understanding that is contained within the vast expanse of human history.
